intro: Chamaefilix ruta-muraria, commonly known as rock rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rosaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in early spring. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with serrated edges and a slightly hairy texture. Chamaefilix ruta-muraria is adapted to harsh environments and is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover in dry landscapes.
